channel.title: typo on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in typo on Barefoot Rob

item.title: typo close to legalese
item.description: 10:59 Friday 16 February 2018 JST I cannot decide if I should care that my accountants apparently cannot spell or cannot hire proofreaders or what. Does it make a difference? Should I complain? Stop using them? Is this just a case of English language changing? I mean language is a tool to transmit meaning between people and written language is a tool to transmit meaning across time as well. I know what they mean, but could there be a case where it’s not clear?

item.title: typos when reporting typos
item.description: ##11:47am Thursday 27 November 2014## (written 00:24 Sunday 21 December 2014 JST) I saw a crappy transcription of a screenshot apparently taken from the Sony hack. It’s even more amazing after they implied they had kept the errors intact: Original text: We've already warned you, and this is just a beginning. Reported text: We've already wasned you, and this is just a beggining. wut.
